result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian T Fuller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR at this time
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to request furlough, filed by Atty Kelz
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Request Furlough, filed by Atty Karl Kelz
Review hearing on November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF1, 16CF39, 16CF125, 16CM1.  16CF125-PH-State calls Deputy Dan Glaze, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Kelz.  Witness dismissed.  State rests, Court will bind DE over, probable cause found, bind over for JT.  Will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of information,enter plea of NG.  MH in 15CF206-Court will finish reading briefs.  Will give oral ruling on briefs, Atty may appear telephonic, 11-14-16 @ 3:30PM.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond, DE would like to do an evulation at Aurora but needs to be released to do this.  Mother will make arrangements for appt and contact the jail when made, DE will be released for the day only,  DE will also be allowed to go to Rice Lake for an assessment in September for a one day furlough. DE told the consequence of not returning to jail if allowed release for these matters.  Mother will transport for the appointments, and return DE to jail after each appointment.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz appearing telephonic.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF1, 16CF39, 16CM1.  Atty Kelz has filed a motion.  Set for 8/30/16 @ 3:00PM for RH.
Review hearing on August 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Dated 8/02/16 from Julie Fuller to Judge Anderson
Review hearing on August 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

DE must reside with Angela Anderson, will have a curfew from 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM each day, absolutely no drugs in the home.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood,   Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  Bonds concurrent.
Review hearing on June 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF206, 16CF1, 16CM1.  DE will waive the PH in 16CF39.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, court will accept waiver.  Court will find probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Information filed, will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of the information, enter a plea of NG.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond.  DE has a close friend to stay with.  Court will grant a $2500.00 sign bond, DE must reside with Angela Sanderson, will have a curfew from 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM each day, absolutely no drugs in the home,    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood,   Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed. Set for RH 6-07-16 @ 2:00PM.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brian T Fuller in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz appearing telephonic.  Defendant Brian T Fuller in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court reads CC to DE.  DE understands.  Motion to modify bond-Atty Kelzs addresses the court, asking for sign bond.  Court will release on a $1500.00 sign bond,  DE must live with his mother and be with his mother at all times.  DE will not be released until arrangements have been made with his mother.   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Will remove the PBT condition from all bonds.  DE will waive time limits for PH.  Set for PH 4-25-16 @ 1:00PM.
